UpperArmsBBCloseGripBenchPress.name: Barbell Close Grip Bench Press
UpperArmsBBCloseGripBenchPress.preparation: Lie on bench and grasp barbell from rack with shoulder width grip.
UpperArmsBBCloseGripBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest with elbows close to body. Push barbell back up until arms are straight. Repeat.
UpperArmsBBCloseGripBenchPress.comments: Grip can be slightly narrower than shoulder width but not too close. Too close of grip can decrease range of motion, may tend to hyperadduct wrist joint, and unnecessarily decrease stability of bar. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

UpperArmsBBCloseGripInclineBenchPress.name: Barbell Close Grip Incline Bench Press
UpperArmsBBCloseGripInclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie on bench with bar above chest. Grasp bar from rack with shoulder width or slightly narrower grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
UpperArmsBBCloseGripInclineBenchPress.execution: Lower weight to chest with elbows close to body. Push barbell up until arms are straight. Repeat.
UpperArmsBBCloseGripInclineBenchPress.comments: Grip can be slightly narrower than shoulder width but not too close. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

UpperArmsBBJMPress.name: Barbell JM Bench Press
UpperArmsBBJMPress.preparation: Lie on bench with back flat on bench and grasp barbell from rack with shoulder width or slightly narrower grip.
UpperArmsBBJMPress.execution: Lower in straight line toward neck while keeping elbows relatively high and bending them out to sides, approximately 45 from midline of body. Flex wrists slightly as bar is lowered as to keep weight of bar on base of palms. Pause when forearms mak e solid contact with biceps. Push barbell back up until arms are straight. Repeat.
UpperArmsBBJMPress.comments: Movement is hybrid between Bench Press and Triceps Extension. A false grip or standard thumb opposing grip can be taken, approximately 16 (40 cm) apart for men. Bar is brought downward anywhere between chin and upper chest. As to minimize shoulder involvement, keep elbows up, allowing elbow to fold upon itself. Range of motion is determined by muscle mass of forearm and biceps. After mastering form and gradually progressing in resistance, push barbell upward more rapidly for greater power development. Exercise was created by 4 time world bench press champion JohnMark Blakely. However, exercises name was reportedly coined by Louie Simmons and George Halbert when Blakely was training at Westside Barbell. Also known as Blakely Press.

UpperArmsBBLyingTriExt.name: Barbell Lying Triceps Extension
UpperArmsBBLyingTriExt.preparation: Lie on bench with narrow overhand grip on barbell. Position barbell over forehead with arms extended.
UpperArmsBBLyingTriExt.execution: Lower bar by bending elbows. As bar nears head, move elbows slightly back just enough to allow bar to clear around curvature of head. Extend arms. As bar clears head, reposition elbows to their former position until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsBBLyingTriExt.comments: With arms fully extended, bar can be brought back over upper chest. Shoulders can be internally rotated between repetitions as needed to allow for relative release of tension in muscles. Barbell can be received from the floor or from rack either situated over abdomen or from behind head. Exercise can also be performed with straight barbell. Movement with cambared bar as shown above is also known as EZ Barbell or EZ Bar Lying Triceps Extension.
UpperArmsBBLyingTriExt.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, pectoralisclavicular, deltoidanterior, wristflexors, pectoralissternal

UpperArmsBBDeclineTriExt.name: Barbell Decline Triceps Extension
UpperArmsBBDeclineTriExt.preparation: Lie on decline bench with narrow overhand grip on barbell. Position barbell over shoulders with arms extended.
UpperArmsBBDeclineTriExt.execution: Lower bar by bending elbows. As bar nears head, move elbows slightly back just enough to allow bar to clear around curvature of head. Extend arms. As bar clears head, reposition elbows to its former position until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsBBDeclineTriExt.comments: With arms fully extended, bar can be brought back over shoulders. Shoulders can be internally rotated between repetitions as needed to allow for relative release of tension in muscles. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used.
UpperArmsBBDeclineTriExt.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, deltoidanterior, wristflexors, pectoralissternal

UpperArmsBBInclineTriExt.name: Barbell Incline Triceps Extension
UpperArmsBBInclineTriExt.preparation: Lie on slightly incline bench with narrow overhand grip on barbell. Position barbell over shoulders with arms extended.
UpperArmsBBInclineTriExt.execution: Lower bar by bending elbows. As bar nears head, move elbows slightly back just enough to allow bar to clear around curvature of head. Extend arms. As bar clears head, reposition elbows to their former position until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsBBInclineTriExt.comments: With arms fully extended, bar can be brought back over shoulders. Shoulders can be internally rotated between repetitions as needed to allow for relative release of tension in muscles. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used.
UpperArmsBBInclineTriExt.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, pectoralisclavicular, deltoidanterior, wristflexors

UpperArmsBBLyingTriExtSC.name: Barbell Lying Triceps Extension Skull Crusher
UpperArmsBBLyingTriExtSC.preparation: Lie on bench with narrow overhand grip on barbell. Position barbell over shoulders with arms extended.
UpperArmsBBLyingTriExtSC.execution: Lower bar to forehead by bending elbows. Extend arms and repeat.
UpperArmsBBLyingTriExtSC.comments: Slow barbells descent as it approaches forehead. Exercise can also be performed with elbow traveling slightly back during extension. With this altered form, barbell essentially moves in straight line, up and down, over forehead. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. See Lying Triceps Extension Bench with rack.
UpperArmsBBLyingTriExtSC.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, pectoralisclavicular, deltoidanterior, wristflexors, pectoralissternal

UpperArmsBBTriExt.name: Barbell Triceps Extension
UpperArmsBBTriExt.preparation: Position barbell overhead with narrow overhand grip.
UpperArmsBBTriExt.execution: Lower forearm behind upper arm with elbows remaining overhead. Extend forearm overhead. Lower and repeat.
UpperArmsBBTriExt.comments: Let barbell pull arm back to maintain full shoulder flexion. Exercise may be performed standing or on seat with or without back support. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used.
